heading: Buying From Sellers with 90 Ship Time-DON'T Do It!!
body: Hey Fellow Ebayers, the past month I watched 5 items I bought over 60 days ago drop off "My Purchase History".Â  They were all very cheap & was in no hurry to get. When I paid my crummy 75 cents or less for each, I knew the sellers said 90 days until estimated delivery. So I expected a long wait.Â I did not expect each of the 5 items to disappear from my History or my "need to leave feedback list". It's like they never existed!Â  I just emailed the seller in China (yes I know....) who said, "sorry can send 5 more or can refund you." duh.Â  My lesson to you is look out if the shipping estimate is 90 days or so. This means the tracking number is fake, you won't see the item. Â  I admit to this happening many times in my 10+ years of shopping here. But thankfully this is the 1st seller to even message me back. I have a teeny bit of hope. This time.Â  Be careful even if it's a small bit of money. They sold very low yes. But we still should get the item!!!

heading: What do we do if the USPS closes or drastically increase shipping fees ???
body: As a seller on Ebay,Â  I'm growing increasingly concerned about the future of the USPS (United States Postal Service)...Â The maniac in the White House wants to force them to charge up to four times their current fees, become privatized, or shut down completely..Â If he gets his way, it will very likely mean the end of "media mail".. and as a result, shipping fees will be outrageousÂ and unaffordable...Â I'm wondering what others sellers and buyers are planning on doing if / when our postal system is guttedÂ  ??Â Personally, I'm not ready to retire...Â  Â  Stay safe everyone...Â  Â  Ed O.

heading: HO Trains - Repair of Crown Gears on Mantua Steam Locomotives
body: Fri 5-15-2020 7:30 a.m.Â Mantua steam locomotives are fitted with a nylon worm gear and a nylon crown gear.Â  Over time, the teeth on the crown gear wear away in the middle.Â  Eventually, the flat spur gear tooth (angled to match the helical gear) may become severely dished (concave) and the helical gear will no longer engage the crown gear.Â  The motor will free spin and the locomotive wheels will not move.Â Mantua locomotives are a very good product, but there is a basic problemÂ  running two gears together which are made from the same material.Â  For example, it is not a good idea to run two brass gears together due to galling and wear. Â  Frequent lubrication does help. Â  (Note: Akane brass locomotives run a steel worm gear on a micarta composite material made form cloth / phenolic resin.Â  The differing materials provide a drive train with longer life.)Â Historically when I have found a used locomotive with a defective crown gear (an eBay purchase or a train show purchase), I have needed to replace the gear.Â  I either found a used gear or I hand machined a replacement from 1/8-inch thick micarta sheet using the old crown gear as a template (tooling).Â Although I have experienced success making crown gears from micarta for Mantua 4-6-2's and 2-8-2's, I have run into problems more often on the 0-4-0's and 0-6-0's due to the smaller diameter of the crown gear and lack of available gear templates. Â Â  Late last night I had problems with one of my home-made gears on a Mantua 0-6-0 and I was going to fabricate another crown gear from micarta.Instead, I decided on another approach.Â I found a worn-out nylon crown gear mounted on a driver for a Mantua 0-4-0 or Â  0-6-0 with the wear I previously described.Â  I decided to go in and file the space between the gear teeth with a thin diamond cross-section jeweler's file.Â  In addition, I choose to position the file at a 30-degree angle to the driver axle.Â  What this does is to remove material from the outer side of the crown gear tooth (on each side of the crown gear).Â  It is necessary to file one side of the crown gear at a time,Â  turn the gear around 180 degrees, and repeat the filing process.Â  The worn gear tooth material in the middle of the gear tooth is left alone.Â  the filingÂ  actually makes the gear smaller in diameter. Â Â I decided to remove the driver wheels from the axle and mount the axle-crown gear subassembly in my jeweler's vise for filing.Â  I have the capability to remove the driver wheels with a puller tool and re-quarter the wheels.Â  However, it is very likely that the same filing work can be done without even removing the driver wheels. Â  (Note: It might be a good idea to put some masking tape on the driver wheel tires to protect the surfaces during the filing process.)Â Once the 30-degree filing is completed on both sides of the crown gear, some adjustment of the motor is nccessary to engage the smaller-diameter crown gear. Â  The back of the open-frame motor has a small tang with a #2-56 threaded hole for mounting purposes.Â  The tag can be bent down slightly with a pair of needle-nose pliers.Â  This will cause the motor to pivot around the forward mounting screw and permit the helical gear on the motor shaft to engage the crown gear.Â  Alternately, the tang can be shimmed up against the loco chassis.Â Once the gear modification has been made, the surface of the teeth will look a bit ratty (that is, rough and not smooth).Â  A small dab of Vaseline can be applied to the surface to help the gear teeth "run-in" or "wear-in". Â Â Frankly, I was quite surprised it worked, but it did work.Â  Happy salvaging.Â Regards,Â ag01

heading: They Deleted My Draft Listings AGAIN!!!!!
body: On May 8th I sent the following message to customer service:To the person responding, please speak and write good English! I need to be able to understand you.My store is currently on vacation as I had an accident and was hospitalized recently.Â  I have 187 items in my drafts folder. Suddenly I am having trouble accessing over 100 of them. I get an error message saying "looks like something went wrong, please try again". These listings have to be updated or I will lose them!!! With that many listings in the drafts folder, I can't afford to lose any of them!!!I need to speak to someone immediately to determine what the problem is. I have tried to update the listings by going to "complete drafts" but then I get the error message that 119 items cannot be found or accessed!!!The last update on these was April 20th. We HAVE to correct this before I lose most of my listings. Please help IMMEDIATELY!!!Â Â Well, for almost a week I have been in contact with eBay and getting the standard responses of :Â Thank you for reaching eBay Customer Service. I understand that your urgency to have the issue in completing the draft be fox as soon as possible. Â Iâ€™ll explain to you further about it.Â First off, we apologize for the delayed response, due to the high volume of messages we have been receiving recently and limited staffing caused by this pandemic situation, we weren't able to get back to you sooner. We appreciate your patience and understanding on this matter and rest assured that we are working on this to answer your queries as soon as we can. Your patience in waiting is well appreciated.Â as of the moment our technical team is doing their very best to fix the problem as soon as possible. As much as we want and we are eager to resolve it, we need more time to have it resolve. We are also trying to take some other option to find workaround that we can offer to the affected members, but as of now we donâ€™t have yet.Â I hope this information is helpful. If you experience any problems or have additional questions, you can contact us by selecting Help & Contact at the top of most eBay pages.Â Yesterday, they wrote:Â you donâ€™t have to worry because you wonâ€™t lose your listings. As long as they are not removed by you or by eBay, you wonâ€™t lose them.Anyway, I appreciate you for your patience and understanding of the whole process.I wish you and your family good health. Take care always,Â Thanks for choosing eBay. We value your business.Respectfully,Â This afternoon I am missing 100 of my listings!!!!Â  Which technically should not have even been removed until the 20th because they were last updated 4-20.Â  This has happened to me several times in the past.Â  I started on this a week ago with the hope they would fix it.Â  I wrote telling them I am livid!!!Â  The only saving grace is that I kept a photo of the drafts folder but that won't save me the time it will take to have to replicate all of those listings.Â Only once when this happened in the past were they able to recover my listings.Â  Ever after that they gave me the excuse that they could not.Â  I use the eBay system to do my listings, no other program.Â Does anyone have any thoughts or suggestions?Â  I'm under the impression writing to their corporate office is a waste of time.

heading: Buying From Sellers with 90 Ship Time-DON'T Do It!!
body:
@moldy5,Â Chinese sellers have been using the over 60 day, last estimated delivery date scam for years.Â  There has not been a reason for an item to take more than 40 days to be delivered for years, so you should avoid sellers who can't deliver in that amount of time. Â  They do that knowing that people do not fully understand how ebay's Money Back Guarantee works and its time frames, and that they can avoid receiving negative feedback when an item doesn't arrive by the last date since there is a 60 day from the date of purchase window for leaving feedback. Â Yes things fall off purchase histories after 60 days but the History's time frame can be expanded to view purchases going back 3 years.Â  The purchase can also be found on PayPal's site where you can use calendars to set purchase time frames. Once you find the transaction, you can click on it to view the details including the seller's username, and the ebay item number so you can file a dispute and get a refund. Â You have 30 days from the last estimated delivery date to file a dispute.Â  Unfortunately, ebay will bump you over to PayPal to actually get your money back when there is over a 60 day delivery time frame. Â By filing an INR dispute the seller gets a defect on their account, when they cannot prove delivery. Sellers are only allowed a small percentage of defects before they get sanctioned or kicked off the site. They also have to refund and loose the fees paid to eBay and PayPal.

heading: Community Chat, May 13 @ 1:00 pm PT - General Topics
body: To enable more consistent service when providing eBay Top Rated Seller discounts or applying fees, weâ€™re streamlining the seller evaluation timelines from July 2020.Currently, the consequences of your monthly Seller Performance Evaluation applyÂ to listings from the same month as the evaluation.Â Starting in July,Â these consequences will apply to listings in the month after the evaluation.The transition to the new timelines will begin on the June 20 evaluation.There will also be changes to the evaluation rules for earning the Top Rated Plus badge and discounts.Seller Performance Evaluation timelinesÂ Seller Performance EvaluationsÂ on the 20th of the month will affect discounts or fees on transactions in the following month.Top Rated Plus discounts for Top Rated SellersÂ will be applied to qualifying listings the month after evaluation.Seller Below Standards Fees or Service metrics feesÂ will be applied to qualifying listings the month after evaluation.Top Rated Plus badge evaluation changesFrom July, your domestic or international returns policy will be part of your Top Rated Plus badge evaluation. Discounts will be based on the country where the items are listed and the item location.For more information on all of these changes, please go to our dedicated Seller Center page.Â **********************************Â There appears to be some confusion over this policy change by Ebay.Â  Some are of the opinion that we are only being eval'd on the previous 30 day period and no longer the previous 12 months or 90 days depending on how many transactions you have in those periods.Â Would you mind sharing what the above message does not detail that applies to this change?Â  I personally think this change is long overdue.

Since these don't directly cause problems with selling there is no incentive for me to put the effort in to make sure they get fixed.Â  At the same time the various problems with item specifics are annoying.

HiÂ @gwzcomps,Â the incentive for you to notify us of potential improvements to our catalog is so you and other sellers like you can receive the best possible visibility through both eBay search results, and third party search results. It isn't possible for us to create a catalog for every item that has been or is available on eBay, so we rely on our sellers do provide this kind of information and will make adjustments or corrections when needed. To be clear, the catalog is comprised of information provided by our sellers, so any errors you see would be related to incorrect information provided by another member of the Community.Â 
Â 
It is up to you if you would like to share what you are seeing so we can make corrections. Providing a robust catalog greatly improves search results for buyers, leading to increased sales for sellers, so we greatly appreciate any time you can spare to pass along what you are seeing.

	Trinton,Community Team

heading: steal my money
body: First, calm down so you don't make any mistakes. Accept the fact that you aren't going to get your money back by morning. Did the message say that they don't have the one you want in stock and they want you to chose a different bike? Calmly tell them you do not want the alternative bike and that you want your money refunded. Hopefully they refund your money without a hassle. If they don't refund your money without a hassle, you are going to have to wait until the expected delivery date has passed, but not over 30 days, and then go to the ebay Resolution Center to get your money back. Sorry this happened to you. But be smart as you navigate this problem.@wisconsingearhead

heading: May Sales Goals monthly thread
body:
Been a long week. 51 sales / 34 orders, with 6 auctions with bids. Have several batches of elongates ready to put into SixBit and then post... just having energy problems by the time I've got time to do so.Planning to move at least one more load from the house, and now I have to find one of my older racks -- seems you can't pile too many computers on those metal/wood rack systems they sell at Lowes. Lost two shelves - the wood warped, then cracked, then just collapsed. My older racks have thicker, plywood shelves - the can hold a lot more weight. It's just going to be such a pain to unload the current racks, put the new ones in place, and then reload them again. <sigh>Youngest got to spend a weekend with his kids last weekend. Now to clean his trip mess out of my truck! ğŸ™‚ But... he's replacing two tires on Mom's car, oil change on both our vehicles, and hopefully can figure out why that Sirius module he put in my truck isn't working. I'm hoping it's just an antenna issue.Have a great weekend everyone! Memphis is getting warmer and wetter this weekend, then moderating a bit next week. Perfect weather for growing all that grass that need cutting more often these days. <sigh>-Bob.

heading: Please allow people to cancel an order
Community Chat, May 13 @ 1:00 pm PT - General Topics
body: @stylishbeautyÂ wrote:Many eBay sellers are currently dealing with USPS lost packages.Â  Mercari offers $200 shipping protection when using their prepaid labels for lost or damaged items.Â  Why doesn't eBay offer the same seller protection?tyler@ebayÂ I send a lot of packages media mail, USPS is having set backs in various distribution center location, Denver and Chicago especially. They are taking Media Mail packages and putting them to the side, disregarding deliver by dates. Last week I had to be on the phone with USPS over 6 hrs for one package that was 15 days late at date of first USPS call (media mail is 15 days til USPS will open investigation), the cases are being given a pre-fabricated covid-19 delay response and the cases closes automatically within a few hours of opening one. That particular package did finally arrive at the buyers address over 21 days later. However now I have 4 package sitting in Denver for a week now and 2-3 sitting in Chicago for about the same. I contacted the buyers and explained there is nothing I can do and just have to be patient as USPS will not do anything except give you the covid set back response. However, I have been placing insurance on most all package now in case something never gets delivered - but this is a cost of little under $2 average that I have to pay for because Ebay doesn't provide the option for sellers to have insurance as option on listings - simply been doing it cause the USPS system is slipping in various locations - mostly their largest and most busy distribution centers.Â Some info for those having issues with packages being held up and sitting for days on end: First the packages are NOT lost, they are simply tossed to the side and thrown into bins where they sit till days/weeks later they decide to move them forward. If you call USPS you will be on hold a minimal of 2 hours to talk to a agent - use the call back feature they will then call you when it's your turn. If you open a case on a package know that within a few hours you will receive an email stating a general pre-fabricatedÂ  response stating covid-19 setbacks and you case is automatically closed. To move the process faster and to rule out any actual lost packages open a case does not require USPS to search for the package and find out what is going on. You MUST file a separate Missing Mail report - done through USPS website only then will USPS actually try and find your package. There will be two options when you open the missing mail case - 1. for package to be delievered to buyer 2. for package to be delivered back to sender (you) - it's your choice - I always put option 1 and the package magically starts getting hits on the tracking and delivers within a week (maynot be for all but it seems to spark USPS to do something).Â I have been mailing those buyers whom packages are delayed or late so they know I am keeping an eye on them and trying - but reality is nothing you or anyone can do but wait on USPS.

heading: Ebay says buyer hasn't paid but buyer says otherwise
body: Hi, you can send the buyer a screenshot picture from your Paypal account showing no payment + that picture you posted here of your Ebay account showing they have not paid.Â Send them that message in writing, to have it documented on Ebay, in case a case is opened & they try to scam you. All your correspondence will be read by an Ebay agent. They may have 33 + reviews but they know you are new & have none.Â Now, I just realized something. Perhaps Ebay or Paypal is holding your payment because you are a new seller.Â Call Paypal first & ask if they see it. 888-221-1161. You can also send a message to an Ebay representative from the main homepage. Scroll down to the bottom of the page & look for contact button. They respond pretty fast.

heading: What do we do if the USPS closes or drastically increase shipping fees ???
body: I too am really concerned about what's going on with the US Postal service, and those who aren't apparently have nothing to lose like we do ourselves. I guess its easy for people who have no lives to sit here and tell you not to worry about the possibility of losing your livelihood. Those same people definitely aren't speaking for you or me.Â As for others claims to just use a different shipping service, that's not even remotely possible, as there's no way consumers are going to pay $10 to ship a movie or a game. I would be out of business for sure, so would ebay as a whole.Â As for Trump's insistence USPS raise rates, he better tread lightly, otherwise the economy will collapse worse than it did after the garbage tax bill he enacted when he first took office.Â On the other hand, Trump, the republicans, and democrats collectively, did the right thing with the recent stimulus measures that are already enacted. As long as we stay the course our economy should be perfectly fine.Â Let's just hope Trump, along with the new post master general, as well as congress, have enough common sense to realize any disruption to our postal service would have a huge negative impact on the livelihoods all all Americans.Â The consequences of raising USPS rates even one penny for the average consumer or e-commerce merchants would result in instant inflation. Raising rates for Amazon makes sense, they got a free ride for too long and should be paying the same rates as the rest of us.

You don't privatize the military (Junta, anyone?).Â Â And you don't privatize the mail. I'm not making plans because it's inconceivable to me. heading: What do we do if the USPS closes or drastically increase shipping fees ???
body:
There is SO much misinformation about this, and it's being promulgated everywhere - doesn't matter which political end of the spectrum, because it's being used for a political football.Â I'm behind a couple of Trump's initiatives (renegotiating China's status in the UPU and clearing up the USPS's debt picture) but I don't agree that Amazon is the sole problem. Prefunding is a big part of it.Â Where is DeFazio's bill to get rid of the Bush era prefunding?Â  Stuck in the senate still?Â  Why?Â  I haven't seen any movement of this bill since it was passed by the House in February.Â  This is a bipartisan bill to enable the USPS to get onto the same business footing as other major companies and get rid of that prefunding, which definitely is the biggest factor in the USPS's debt problem.Â  There are myriad other problems, but this really is what takes the USPS out of solvency using their own products and services, to insolvency.Â As for Amazon, they get charged bulk shipping rates, which cannot by law be lower than base parcel delivery.Â  For the most part, the USPS simply provides last mile delivery from pre-sorted bulk shipping, including Amazon.Â  Thing is, right now Amazon is lumped in with other bulk shippers in the billions of revenue the USPS realises by shipping this stuff.Â  I'd be curious to know much they actually contribute to this revenue - I have a feeling it's not insignificant.Â Â I don't think anything is going to go up four-fold - there's so much noise about this stuff, but I CAN see Bezos just shrugging his shoulders if it's decided that Amazon's contract will be negotiated and say "fine, we'll just do our own last-mile logistics - we've been migrating to that anyway."Â  There goes about 30% of the USPS parcel service...and the money.Â 

No pants, just ashes.

heading: Everyone do the math, we actually will pay more fees by Managed Payments!
body: This is a new game eBay plays in order to make more money by charge sellers more fees and replacing Paypal.Everyone do the math, we actually will pay more fees by MP because currently we pay 2.9% Paypal fee for sales tax, but MP will increase the final value feeÂ additional +2.35%, (for example 10% FVF will become 12.35%), and the new FVF will also include sales tax. That means seller will pay 12.35% FVF on sales tax instead of only pay 2.9% when using Paypal.Â Here is an example for a $100 item total price include shipping, 10% sales tax ($10), 10% FVF before and 12.35% FVF after MP andÂ total cost for buyer is $110. Compare the old and new fees as below:Â Old fees: $10 FVF+3.49 PP fee ( 2.9% from total+0.30ï¼‰=$13.49 total feesNew fee: $13.59 FVE+0.30 MP flat fee=$13.89 total feesWill pay $0.40 more fee for ebay MP in this case.Â Also, for refunds and cancellations, ebay states the $0.30 per order fee will not be credited. This is unfair when cancellations often requested by buyers for their mistake.Â So, basically ebay just move numbers around in order to charge more money from us! This will also force sellers not to use Paypal because no one wants to pay additional 2.9% PP fee after being charged HIGH final value fee, that would be like charged fee for twice.Â Is it actually legal for ebay to make profitÂ on sales tax by charging FVF from it?

heading: Donâ€™t buy from China!!!
body: Iâ€™ve been using eBay since 2001, but about 10 years ago it seemed to get flooded with Chinese sellers that now thatâ€™s all there seems to be. I never once recall a package not arriving, but lately I cannot tell you how many packages failed to arrive. I realize that packages do get lost or stolen in transit, but in every case the tracking number is always â€œnot found.â€ So the numbers provided are clearly fake. Most recently I ordered some earrings from a Chinese seller who provided a bogus tracking number. I alerted the seller and was given an excuse about a â€œlogistics delay,â€ and that they could reship the package right away, and that it would be approximately 15 more business days. I asked for a tracking # for the â€œnewâ€ package. I was told there was another â€œdelayâ€ and it would be another week. Still no package. Again I was told they would resend it along with the same â€œlogisticsâ€ excuse. I told them to provide a THIRD tracking # for the THIRD package they supposedly sent. This time I was told that the Â was â€œtoo smallâ€ and they couldnâ€™t give me one. I ripped into them and threatened negative FB. Clearly the listing is fake and they are advertising items that they do NOT even have and donâ€™t intend to ever send!!! So they will give buyers the run around in hopes that the window to file a dispute will expire. I noticed others made similar claims of items not being shipped in the FB. eBay removed the listing from my purchase list so I canâ€™t leave negative FB, so they must be onto their tactics. I have reported the seller and have filed a dispute with PayPal. Itâ€™s not a lot of money here, but thatâ€™s not the point. You canâ€™t just jack people around and take peopleâ€™s money for things you donâ€™t have. Iâ€™m also fed up with receiving items that are just cheap knockoffs and look nothing like the item pictured. This is unacceptable and I wish eBay would crack down on their bogus sellers. From now on I am selecting to purchase from North America only. More buyers should do the same.

heading: Community Chat, May 13 @ 1:00 pm PT - General Topics
body: brian.t@ebayÂ wrote:@mam98031Â wrote:brian.t@ebayÂ wrote:@mam98031Â wrote:To enable more consistent service when providing eBay Top Rated Seller discounts or applying fees, weâ€™re streamlining the seller evaluation timelines from July 2020.Currently, the consequences of your monthly Seller Performance Evaluation applyÂ to listings from the same month as the evaluation.Â Starting in July,Â these consequences will apply to listings in the month after the evaluation.The transition to the new timelines will begin on the June 20 evaluation.There will also be changes to the evaluation rules for earning the Top Rated Plus badge and discounts.Seller Performance Evaluation timelinesÂ Seller Performance EvaluationsÂ on the 20th of the month will affect discounts or fees on transactions in the following month.Top Rated Plus discounts for Top Rated SellersÂ will be applied to qualifying listings the month after evaluation.Seller Below Standards Fees or Service metrics feesÂ will be applied to qualifying listings the month after evaluation.Top Rated Plus badge evaluation changesFrom July, your domestic or international returns policy will be part of your Top Rated Plus badge evaluation. Discounts will be based on the country where the items are listed and the item location.For more information on all of these changes, please go to our dedicated Seller Center page.Â **********************************Â There appears to be some confusion over this policy change by Ebay.Â  Some are of the opinion that we are only being eval'd on the previous 30 day period and no longer the previous 12 months or 90 days depending on how many transactions you have in those periods.Â Would you mind sharing what the above message does not detail that applies to this change?Â  I personally think this change is long overdue.HiÂ @mam98031! There hasn't been an announced change to the look back period that I'm aware of, so that should remain the same ğŸ™‚I get that and I had no issues following the email.Â  But some have construed this to mean that the look back changed.Â  It might be help to suggest that Ebay create another email for everyone that also explains the look back remains the same.Â As a side note, this email ONLY came to My Messages and did not drop into my personal email account like all my other Ebay emails do.Â  If it wasn't for the Unread Message note on My Seller Hub I would not have even noticed this email.Â  So it is possible that many members out there are experiencing the same thing and are unaware of the email all together.ThanksÂ @mam98031! I can pass along the suggestion ğŸ™‚brian.t@ebayÂ I'm one that didn't receive the email through eBay or my email. Read about it here, though. FWIW...

You will need to offer a minimum of 30-day free domestic returns.If the item location is not in the same country as the listing site, eBay will use the international return policy for the Top Rated Plus badge and discount evaluation. heading: Community Chat, May 13 @ 1:00 pm PT - General Topics
body:
@gwzcompsÂ wrote:
trinton@ebayÂ wrote:
@gwzcompsÂ wrote:
So in a previous chat it was mentioned that I can email eBay about issues with item specifics.Â  I genuinely was going to, but the more I list the more problems I find.Â  I don't understand what my incentive is to make sure you guys have the right stuff setup for your item specifics.Â  I also question the competence of the people who set them up.Â 
Â 
Example: Document scanners can't print and what do RAID levels have to do with networking switches?Â 
Â 
Since these don't directly cause problems with selling there is no incentive for me to put the effort in to make sure they get fixed.Â  At the same time the various problems with item specifics are annoying.

HiÂ @gwzcomps,Â the incentive for you to notify us of potential improvements to our catalog is so you and other sellers like you can receive the best possible visibility through both eBay search results, and third party search results. It isn't possible for us to create a catalog for every item that has been or is available on eBay, so we rely on our sellers do provide this kind of information and will make adjustments or corrections when needed. To be clear, the catalog is comprised of information provided by our sellers, so any errors you see would be related to incorrect information provided by another member of the Community.Â 
Â 
It is up to you if you would like to share what you are seeing so we can make corrections. Providing a robust catalog greatly improves search results for buyers, leading to increased sales for sellers, so we greatly appreciate any time you can spare to pass along what you are seeing.

I am not referring to the catalog.Â  That is one thing I will put zero effort in to fixing unless I am getting paid.Â  The whole catalog idea is too broken to salvage even people who sell on Amazon will admit that.Â  I am more concerned about the item specifics directly.Â  The example being with how document scanners apparently are capable of printing too?Â  Last I knew document scanners only scan, no printing as that would make it a printer.
Â 


HiÂ @gwzcomps, happy to clarify that item specifics are the catalog - the team that reviews the item specifics concerns you have raised is our catalog team. The catalog is created using the item specifics that our sellers have provided. The example you have given can be sent to our catalog team directly by emailing sdsupport@eBay.com.

	Trinton,Community Team

This is to ensure the listing isn't drastically changed and the buyer ends up with something very different than what they had originally placed an offer on (changes such as the price being increased, shipping cost increased, condition of the item changed, images that show a different condition than originally advertised).Â 
Â 
If you receive an offer and notice that something needs to be updated in the listing that would alter the item significantly, then you'll want to consider declining the offer and making the needed revision.Â 

	Brian,Community Team

heading: Community Chat, May 13 @ 1:00 pm PT - General Topics
body:
@creativecrisisÂ wrote:
In the current situation, what protections are available for sellers against late shipping?
Â 
I've maintained my one-day shipping schedule, but am no longer standing in line at the post office to get manual acceptance scans. Frequently the post office is not providing an acceptance scan on the day I drop off packages. For example, some items I mailed on Monday 5/11 have yet to receive an acceptance scan as of this morning. (!)
Â 
I think the postal service is overwhelmed, and I'm very concerned about getting "late shipping" dings as a result. What, if any, protections are in place, and how will they be applied?
Â 
Thank you.

HiÂ @creativecrisis,Â in addition to extending estimated delivery dates for most shipments, we are also taking steps to protect seller performance levels under the current circumstances. You can read more about this here:Â https://community.ebay.com/t5/Announcements/Protecting-your-seller-performance-during-COVID-19/ba-p/...
Â 
We are committed to keeping an eye on how current events are affecting our Community and will work to provide appropriate protections.

	Trinton,Community Team

heading: account was hacked closed shop now items not showing? Can anyone help please?
body: @theloudhouseÂ wrote:My account was recently hacked when I put holiday settings on for Easter.Â  I saw the listings being uploaded and contacted ebay immediately and they were taken down.Â  I have left the shop closed until today.Â I have opened my shop again today, but hardly any of my items are showing when I search for them, I can also see the hackers items when I go through the menus of contacting ebay, as in I can contact them about something recently sold (like a rolex watch or horse saddle etc).Â Is there anything I need to do to get my items in the search or should I contact ebay again - I did speak to them earlier as had to remove the temporary block that they had placed on the account.Â Thank you.Have you looked on Seller Hub under Unsold and Ended items? If the listings expired, you can bulk-relist them that way. It will give you the option to(a) List similar (if you chose this option, you will need to manually remove the expired / usold listings from the list, once the new listings have populated).Â (b) List as Fixed Price (in case the old listings were Auction style), this will automatically erase the relisted items from the Usold items list, no need for further action), or(c) simply click, Relist (this, two, will automatically remove the old listings so you do not have to worry about manually removing them).Â All these options are hidden in a drop-down menu at the top center, above the list of Unsold items.Â Â Once thing to keep in mind: In case the old listings were Auction style ones, and you elected to just click Relist, you will need to manually edit each and every relisted item to check the box in the listing template for "Automatically relist it 8 times).Â I hope this helps. I cannot help you with the illegitimate listing removal, especially, because it looks like they removed them already once for you and now they are back - for that, I recommend contacting eBay.Â Â Take carePW

heading: Accidentally Accepted Return and got cheated by buyer
body: Hello,Â First off I just wanna propose a big brain idea that I hope ebay can implement. Its called an "Are you sure you want to accept this return" prompt when you press accept return, Instead of immediately issuing the buyer a full refund with no recourse. Im not the only one they tries to navigate this trechorous and confusing menus and accidentally hit the wrong button which screws up my whole day.Â Â Let me provide some context. So about two weeks ago, I sold an iPhone X I had lying around that was iCloud Locked. I made it very clear that it was iCloud locked Â and meant to be used for its parts. While it was activation locked, I was able to bypass the activation and get into the home screen and access the setting and cameras to verify all the hardware was working and it was. In the pictures I proved that battery, faceID, etc were all working fine. But I said it in the description in all caps and it was a For Parts listing since it is iCloud locked it cannot be activated. I also noted it as SOLD AS IS and NO RETURNS. Â But of course there just has to be that one dude that has to completely disregard my description. 2 weeks after It was delivered and after my funds were released. This dude opens a return request and says the most unbelievable **bleep** I heard in a while. Firstly He send me a photo of the phone I sent out. Which looked exactly how I sent out and looked like the photo. But this guy said "why reset this iPhone? I bought iPhone which one have in menu and working condition and now you reset it and I got trash, I want turn this item back or refund $80 minimum, thanks" I bursted out laughing because the iPhone costed him $150 and he was asking for more then half it back and to keep it.Â Â Yes he wasn't making very much sense but anyway, I reply that I made it very clear that It was iCloud locked and that I wasn't going to give him a dime, and that it was exactly as described. So they he messages me back that he got a "different condition phone," Â and says "I don't care about your description because this is different condition." Which blows my mind because my description states the condition and this guy is an enormous idiot. Â His response made 0 sense.Â So then I tell him that I sent him the same exact phone as in the description, same exact serial number, and same exact condition as in the listing photos. I saw no new cracks, or damage at all. I tell him its not my fault he didn't read the description. Then he asks me for $50 instead of $80 or he's going to return it. He also tells me to "stop wasting his time"Â Â At this point I was eager for him to escalate the claim to eBay because I Just had overwhelming evidence against this buffoon and I was willing to wait the several days for eBay to review this caseÂ But of course the title!Â While I was navigated the amazon forest looking for the god dang button to report a person, one thing led to another and accidentally graced the Accept Return button. Just like that it was game over, GG nothing else to do but suck up the $150 dollar loss. Good bye Forever $150 all because multimillion dollar monopoly eBay cannot add an "Are you Sure?" prompt. it does not matter at all anymore, eBay support can't do nothing nor the CEO. Your F'edÂ Before, people were always on edge about buying on eBay and buying fake stuff. The real nightmare are for the sellers that have to deal with a influx of scam buyers that want to pay me 400% more to ship to Nigeria or Albania.Â Â In conclusion... eBay sucks and PLEASE don't make these mistakes-Dont Use mobile devices to handle return requests.Â -Be aware of scammers-Be aware of scammersÂ -Also be aware of scammers-Dont use eBay to sell, Use mercari , your own website , or amazon for your own good.Â Thank you for reading my app and fix this site, I'm not the only one with this issue

heading: Please allow people to cancel an order
body: The point of having the cancellation option available is if the seller agrees then theyÂ  can easily do it from the request by hitting one button. Otherwise to cancel they'd have to go to their sold history and sift through the number of items sold to find the item and copy the item number and theÂ  go to the Resolution Center and after several more steps it's cancelled.Â  A lot of sellers are set up so as soon as it's sold the shipping process begins. A third party may be involved (shipper or dropshipper) who was automatically notified and the seller is unable to cancel that.Â  Please don't buy until you're sure you want it because the bottom line is if you buy it you're obligated to pay and the seller is obligated to ship. If you made a mistake then if the seller accepts returns return it for a refund or if they don't then resell it.

heading: I bought a car from a seller and itcstate my money will not go to the seller intel i receive my vec
body: @dabrown27Â Â I am sorry to say you have made a deal with a scammer, not eBay.Â That is not how eBay works. eBay does not rely on users finding ads on Facebook or Craigslist and sending contact information to a seller. Likely the seller sent a phony "invoice" that appears to be from eBay but is not, asking you to pay with gift cards to have the vehicle shipped to you for a free evaluation period.Â eBay has no warehouse and does not ship vehicles. eBay does not handle such transactions or provide "vehicle protection orders". Scammers often promise those things, though. Any phone number you may receive on such an "invoice" does not connect to eBay, but to the scammer.Â Anyone that asks you to purchase gift cards or to send card codes to them to complete a transaction is trying to take advantage of you. Anyone asking for a gift card is looking for a gift at your expense. Once anyone else knows the code, your money will be gone and you will have no recourse.Â See here for some info about such scams:Â https://pages.motors.ebay.com/buy/security/index.htmlÂ https://www.fbi.gov/scams-and-safety/common-fraud-schemes/online-vehicle-sale-fraudÂ The only way to purchase a vehicle on eBay is to sign in to eBay.com, find the vehicle on eBay and complete the checkout process on eBay. You may have to pay a deposit. Then you typically meet the seller to inspect the vehicle and pay the seller.Â If you encountered an ad on another site, contact that site to have the ad removed. eBay is not involved with any ads listed on sites other than eBay itself.

heading: Please allow people to cancel an order
body:
It appears that you need to exercise more diligence when shopping online to avoid making those mistakes that cause you to wish to cancel transactions.Â  The time to decide if you want to purchase an item is prior to placing your order or bid.Â I'm not quite sure where you get the idea that it is reasonable for buyers to be allowed to cancel transactions.Â  As it is, buyers are permitted to request a cancellation but sellers are not required to comply with the request.Â  Here is why your idea is not reasonable:1)Â  Once you hit the buy now button, the item is removed from available sale.Â  Thus the seller is taking a loss of time that the item is not available to be sold because of the cancellation.2)Â  The seller has already been charged the FVF (eBay's Commission) the moment that the buyer places the order.3)Â  If the item has been paid for through PayPal at the time of purchase, the seller has already lost the PayPal fees from that transaction.Â  4)Â  The seller loses time in having to relist the item and as the saying goes, "Time is money."Â For the above items it is the not reasonable to give buyers the unilateral ability to cancel transactions.Â  Thus, while the buyer may ask to cancel, it is the seller that must remain in control of the final decision.Â While I'm not very familiar with the laws governing auctions in the UK, here in the US placing a bid on an item being sold at auction is, under the laws of most states governing auctions, deemed to be a legally binding contract if the bid is the winning one.Â  Thus a bidder that then wants to cancel the sale after its closing could find themselves in litigation if they could simply cancel the transaction on their own.Â Thus there is nothing to fix.

	"It is an intelligent man that is aware of his own ignorance."

ebay is totally ignoring our shipping policies, including our stated handling times. I previously offered 2 day handling times with standardÂ  shipping, which collectively would be 7 business days, yet I am being given just 2 or 3 days to have items delivered.
Â 
I've now had to switch to 3 business day handling times, despite the fact I ship everything in 1 business day to begin with.
Â 
ebay is even telling buyers that their media mail purchases will arrive in 2 days, and for buyers who're located half way across the country. This is despite the fact USPS says to expect 9 business days delivery for media mail, with no guaranteed delivery dates for this service.
Â 
Either way, I don't want ebay trying to dictate how and when I ship things, that is my business, not ebay's. ebay shouldn't be lying to buyers and ignoring US Postal service policies either.
Â 
I have serious health problems, and I intentionally set my shipping policies to allow headroom to accommodate for it. ebay needs to acknowledge that.

HiÂ @djdaniel2015,Â if you have some examples of estimated delivery dates that you have identified as being inaccurate I'd love to take a look for you. Feel free to start a thread on the Technical Issues board or the Shipping & Returns board with item numbers and the zip code used for the shipment and @mention meÂ so I can test this out and see what might be going on.

	Trinton,Community Team

heading: unpaid items
body: We have been lucky of lately with our auctions with this problem, although we have been in your situation many times before.Â We have found that going to the tab on your seller hub block bidders and setting up your settings for people you want to bid has helped, as we found that many of these non payers were people with only 1 or 2 feedback, also if you set the setting (I can't remember the exact wording) with regards to unpaid items over a certain period eg 2 unpaid items over 12 months this may help.Â Finally if you have any worries about a bidder then especially if they don't reply to an initial "thank you for your purchase last night can you advise when you will pay type of message" we will open the case against them after 48 hours, before going to second best bidder on the item - it saves a week of having to relist etc. Hope this helps.

heading: I believe someone is scamming, advice?
body: Hi everyone,I was shopping for a particular art book. Knowing that a miniature version is also published, I was careful to check the page count, page size, and look for differences in the cover layout (the small version has the text closer together).I purchased a book described as the larger version, but was shipped the miniature version anyway: in other words the page count/size/photo were lies. And this seller is selling multiple copies of this item, so I worry that other people are being misled as well.Â I calmly told them that it is not the item in the description, and haven't heard back yet: What is the best course of action?Â Thanks!Augustine

heading: The Decision Has Been Made-No Grandfathering MP Fees
body: The increased final value fee will also apply to sales tax. We will actually pay more fees by Managed Payments!Think about the new 12.35% FVF (for most categories) charge from tax instead of 2.9% Paypal fee charge.Â So, basically ebay just move numbers around to fool us in order to charge more money from us! This will also force sellers not to use Paypal because no one wants to pay additional 2.9% PP fee after already being charged HIGH final value fee, that would be like charged fee for twice. This is a perfect way for ebay to take over Paypal's business. Double win for ebay but bad for sellers especially during COVID-19!

heading: seller info
body: @leonarmille_20Â Â what do i do when i have made the purchase alreadyÂ If the seller is a scammer, there is no point in asking to cancel -- scammers won't. And if the seller is not a scammer, you have just caused a headache for an innocent seller by cancelling.Â Typically you have to wait until the last estimated delivery date has passed to start an Item Not Received claim on eBay; if the seller is removed and eBay does not send you a message about that, and if you can no longer find the item in your Resolution Center, you can start the process on your PayPal account (if you used PayPal) or your credit card account. There are various deadlines that have to be met at each stage, and you must take care not to make more than one claim about a single transaction at a time or your claim may be dismissed.Â If the seller actually ships something (but not your item), you must file a Significantly Not As Described claim (and typically return the item), as a valid tracking number that shows delivery would cause you to lose an Item Not Received claim. There are other scams that involve shipping an item to another location in your zip code which can complicate matters further.Â Bookmark the seller's feedback page so that you can monitor that to see if the seller's account has been removed from eBay, just in case the item listing disappears.

heading: Seller Standards Update: New seller evaluation timeline & Top Rated Plus badge changes
body: @cynthealee2Â wrote:@mam98031Â wrote:@cynthealee2Â wrote:What is "Service Metrics"?The Service Metrics is a completely different thing.Â  And a crazy policy IMHO.Â https://www.ebay.com/help/policies/selling-policies/seller-performance-policy/service-metrics-policy...OK... so in theory if I had any of these it would be on my Dashboard some where right?Â And what confuses me is the ones where the PO bent the daylights out of the stupid things, they opened cases, and I flat out refunded them aren't showing there at all... so I'm still trying to figure out what they are counting... maybe they timed out before I got around to checking the dashboard????Â See I knew better than to "check out" for an entire year on eBay.... I miss so much stuff when I do that LOL.The Service Metrics has NEVER been on the Seller Dashboard.Â  The Seller Dashboard is completely separate and different.Â The Seller Dashboard are the areas in which Ebay evals you every 20th of the month for the period ending the previous month.Â  It is what will determine your selling status.Â  Defects on your Seller Dashboard are things to avoid.Â  Defects ONLY happen in the areas seen on your Seller Dashboard.Â The Service Metrics can be seen in the Seller Hub under the Performance Tab, list item on the drop down menu.Â  This will only come into play if you have 10+ INADS in the past 12 months or 90 days.Â  This is explained in more detail in the link I gave you above.

We are a large eBay seller wit over 1300 active eBay listings and its getting extremely difficult to stay on-top of all the listings especially do to the fact that we create new listings every day and we add more quantity to the old.
Â 
is there any Application that would help us digest our sales data and let us know what is selling fast so we could look into maybe raising the price or whats not selling or selling slow so we could improve it?
Â 
also what are the best tools for pricing and customer communications and shipping.
please feel free to add any other apps that could be helpful.
Â 
Thank You So MuchÂ 

HelloÂ @ecommtrade45Â ,
Â 
Thank you for your post. I am sure there are some amazing apps out there that are not eBay owned but can get the job done with updating your listings and inventory management. We do have our own app call File Exchange that you can download all your inventory into a CSV and then upload it back into the File Exchange Center, after making the changes to the prices and quantities. This report is called File Exchange > Revise Price & Quantity.Â 
Â 
If you are interested, here is a direct link to the File Exchange Center.
Â 
If your looking for something different, you might want to try researching some online apps that would work best for you. I hope this helps and thanks for your post.
Â 
Sincerely,Â 
Â 
Jacob@eBay
eBay Customer Support.

heading: Fraud and scammers
body: Recently I have been trying to buy a mini digger. I could not believe the amount of fraudulent adverts there are . One guyÂ  Keith Miller, wanted me to send Â£5500 to a paypal account at the Ing bank in Holland as British paypal was down owing to corona virus. A paypal page came up and it was convincing . This machine was for sale in bristol and now it's for sale in halesowen . I have reported these and other cases to ebay and they appear to do nothing . Some poor person is going to get stuffed and they , ebay , have a responsibility to do something .Â  One thing seems to be common to all these adverts is that the seller is out of the office and that contact can be made to an outlook email address. I have bought lots off ebay and it's a good platform but these anus holes are going to screw it up for all the honest traders and buyers .

I figure as long as my line is green on the dashboard I'm ok... and since I fall in and out of TRS none of this really matters to me... Wish I drank... I'm betting most of the new "updates" would make more sense that way.Â  ğŸ™„This isn't a difficult policy to understand.Â  I think both of you have just convinced yourselves that you can't understand it therefore you don't understand it.Â These policies haven't changed for quite a while.Â  They are the same as they were last year and the year before that.Â  And maybe even the year before that.@cynthealee2Â  Â @bbravo65Â Â As Specific Questions and I'll see if I can help.It was a silly comment to commiserate with a fellow boardie...Â  If my stats are green whoo hooo I'll get a discount on my bill... if my stats aren't I got bigger issues to figure out.Â  (I was just confused on the new vocab about "seller metrics" cause I couldn't find that verbiage on my Dashboard)Â *****************************************************************************************************************Rant / Vent starts here:Â The last time I posted on the boards (before March of this year) was July of 2018... At the time I was dealing with Photobucket being stupid... I hadn't paid more than passing attention to an update since the fall update before that.Â Last time I paid attention to TRS (and TRS+) it was simply a matter of sell X amount in a year, and the defects had (I think) just swapped over to cancels/ escalated cases only were being counted.Â Â  I hadn't been TRS for a least a year or more before that cause of "tracking uploaded on time and validated".Â Â Probably the last time I paid REAL close attention to the twice yearly updates as well... Don't get me wrong I read through em... sorta... figured out if they were going to apply to me in any meaningful way, and went on with what I had going on around me at the time.Â  (I remember thinking when MP came out, if they pull me into this I'll quit selling cause I could see the fees would price me out) Now since I don't see me selling here past getting shoved into MP, I'm not really going to pay to much attention to TRS / TRS+ this trip though TRS. (bracelet sales take off and I'm right back out of TRS)Â Really the MOST I ever got out of TRS+ in a month was under $15.00 (though if Bro's cards keep selling like they are I may break 20.00 in June) and every listing I have ever had always qualified for TRS+ if I was TRS.Â  I figured out the other day that they all had to have free returns... fine w/e I switched em all on eBay and went over to Auctiva so I could make all those over there say the same thing...Â Â When Defects FIRST came out I was alllllllll over eBay policy, what it meant, what it meant to ME and FOR me.Â  I spent 6 months or better living on the boards helping people to the point eBay flew me and a bunch of others out to Cali to talk about where they were taking the boards.Â  (to this DAY I still don't know how or why I made it on that list)Â All to have it rewritten, policies changed (without notice for the most part), and new polices enforced (again with out it being posted) the catalog shoved down my throat over toys that last saw the shelves 10 years or more before.Â  I tried again to help both eBay and the boardies this time with the catalog... to be told I was wrong (with pic evidence), that it didn't matter, that changes had been made to find out months later I had again been lied to.Â I'm tired Mam... just tired of trying to stay on top of things for a HOBBY that was supposed to be fun.Â  Tired of learning something (usually the hard way) only to be told 6 months to a year later that everything I just learned was no longer going to apply. And or that it wasn't that important to begin with.Â  Tired of putting my whole effort into something to only have the rug yanked out from underneath meÂ  months or a year later.Â Maybe if I'm still here in Jan (cause I didn't get yanked into MP), I'll pay more attention to the Seller Updates and TRS.Â Till then every now and then I'll pass an imaginary drink to commiserate with a fellow boardie... speaking of.... want one?Â Â 

	I hate photobucket right now... PS Answers given years ago may or may not be current now, please check with current posters to the boards to see if the information is still relevant.

heading: Seller Standards Update: New seller evaluation timeline & Top Rated Plus badge changes
body:
@mam98031Â wrote:@cynthealee2Â wrote:@mam98031Â wrote:@cynthealee2Â wrote:What is "Service Metrics"?The Service Metrics is a completely different thing.Â  And a crazy policy IMHO.Â https://www.ebay.com/help/policies/selling-policies/seller-performance-policy/service-metrics-policy...OK... so in theory if I had any of these it would be on my Dashboard some where right?Â And what confuses me is the ones where the PO bent the daylights out of the stupid things, they opened cases, and I flat out refunded them aren't showing there at all... so I'm still trying to figure out what they are counting... maybe they timed out before I got around to checking the dashboard????Â See I knew better than to "check out" for an entire year on eBay.... I miss so much stuff when I do that LOL.The Service Metrics has NEVER been on the Seller Dashboard.Â  The Seller Dashboard is completely separate and different.Â The Seller Dashboard are the areas in which Ebay evals you every 20th of the month for the period ending the previous month.Â  It is what will determine your selling status.Â  Defects on your Seller Dashboard are things to avoid.Â  Defects ONLY happen in the areas seen on your Seller Dashboard.Â The Service Metrics can be seen in the Seller Hub under the Performance Tab, list item on the drop down menu.Â  This will only come into play if you have 10+ INADS in the past 12 months or 90 days.Â  This is explained in more detail in the link I gave you above.Yep... read it... says INAD/INR... returns are on my Seller Dashboard.Â  says "Neat. You didn't have any returns."Â Last INR I got was a bracelet... never even made case status.... buyer emails goes I didn't get my bracelet.Â  I ask the standard "you know it comes in a little white envelope, could some one else picked it up with the bills?" buyer writes back "nope not there"... I send a second one they write back 2 days later "Second one must have booted the first out of the system cause both arrived today how can I pay for the first one".Â  That was 2 years ago.Â On the Seller Metrics page (which I finally found) it lists INAD's.... I got zip same as the dashboard.Â  I ASSUME they aged off... Cause I could have sworn I had one back before I showed back up on the boards where the PO bent the daylights out of the card.Â  Nope I checked buyer just emailed me a pic of the bent card I just refunded... never even made it on eBay's radar.Â

heading: Seller Standards Update: New seller evaluation timeline & Top Rated Plus badge changes
body: @bbravo65Â ...hahaha...you made me laugh...Glad I could add a little levity to your day.Â ...seriously, I only knew TRS, not TRS+...I knew TRS requires 30 free-returns, free-shipping, guarantee delivery date...that's all I knew...Â NONE of what I underlined is accurate.Â  Qualifying for TRS does NOT require ANY of that.Â ...not a bit of TRS+...specially now with the new MP when it involves in FVF...I can't say that I understand this comment.Â  What about MP?Â  The TRS discount will apply to the Simplified Fee in MP which means that sellers will get the TRS discount on the FVF for the entire transaction plus the money processing fees.Â  Currently we only get it on the FVF for the product sold.Â ...oh, and the timeline for evaluation...to be honest, it's not really clear in eBay message the changes...the written language is confusing...The new eval rule is really very simple.Â  Some are just making it seemÂ  more complicated than it is.Â  CURRENTLY we are eval'd on the 20 of the month for the period ending the previous month.Â  So the May 20th eval is for the period ending April 30.Â  And whatever your Selling status that is determined through that eval is immediately applied to your account.Â The ONLY change is that instead of immediately apply that Selling status to your account, it does not take effect until the first of the following month.Â  Everything else is the same.

heading: Why can't I leave feedback for a item I sold
body:
What error message did you see?Â Is it more than 60 days from the date of the transaction?Â  You can't leave feedback if the transaction is older than 60 days.Â Â Are you trying to leave a neutral or negative feedback comment?Â Â Sellers can only leave positive feedback or none at all.Â Did you file an Unpaid Item Dispute, and you won?Â  If so, you can't leave feedback.Â Did the buyer ask to cancel the transaction?Â Â If so, you can't leave feedback.

body: All,Â I've sent the following personal message to brian_burke@ebayÂ and I'll keep you updated once a response is received.Â I'm a Managed Payment Seller with a store on ebay.Â  Please clarify and validate the following information regarding Final Value Fee.Â 1. "Bad seller".Â  Of course that also took away my 23 year 100% rating.Â Â Â The worst part is that they removed the very legitimate negative feedback I left on his failing to pay / complete transaction but left in place the retaliatory feedback he left for me.Â I went to have this investigated removed but, with limited ebay support items, essentially run into, "too bad for you, it greater than 90 days so go away"

heading: *IMPORTANT* FVF for Managed Payment Sellers
body: I did the math, too. After the new increased final value fee and also apply on sales tax, we'll lose more money.Â Currently we pay 2.9% Paypal fee for sales tax, but MP will increase the final value fee to additional +2.35%, (for example 10% FVF will become 12.35%, not even mention the additionalÂ Promoted listing fee game ), and the new FVF will also include sales tax. That means seller will pay 12.35% FVF on sales tax instead of only pay 2.9% when using Paypal.Â Here is an example for $100 items total price include shipping, 10% sales tax ($10), 10% FVF before and 12.35% FVF after MP andÂ total cost for buyer is $110. Compare the old and new fees as below:Â Old fees: $10 FVF+3.49 Paypal fee ( 2.9% from total+0.30 flat fee)=$13.49 total feesNew fee: $13.59 FVE+0.30 MP flat fee=$13.89 total feesWill pay $0.40 more for ebay MP in this case.

heading: *IMPORTANT* FVF for Managed Payment Sellers
body: Found this under Final Value FeesÂ When your listing ends, you'll be charged a final value fee. The final value fee is based on the item's total cost to the buyer. The item's total cost to the buyer includes item price and shipping cost plus any other costs to the buyer (less any sales tax).Â So where are you seeing FVF charged on Sales tax to?

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: @totaylor_73Â Â It knows my name, asks me to sign in then the sign in screen is greyed out. I've tried it on both my accounts and on 3 different machines. Only way I can sign in is to go to private browsing,then it all worksÂ One difference between private browsing and regular browsing is that your private browser window ignores your regular browser cache and cookies. Try clearing your browser cache and possibly deleting eBay cookies. Or try another browser.Â Also try different sign-in links. There are some US and UK alternative sign-in links in the thread above.

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: I had a similar issue this week on both my eBay accounts. Â It looked like they had updated the LOG In page layout and when I went to log in got diverted several times to a page sting that for "my additional security" I would be asked "from time to time" for more info.Â I seemed to be in a loop I couldn't get out of and then noticed the page had updated with a note that said something like: "having trouble logging in try one of these browsers".Â I use an older Mac Book Pro with Safari and eBay seems intent on pushing us Apple users over onto a Google browser and I have to wonder if such additional hurdles are intentional to force compliance with their goals.Â What type of Browser and hardware do you use? Â A Lot of my glitch issues this week seem to relate to my Safari choice.

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: It seems to be another example of eBay's constant change to many of their most often used pages and they so often come with glitches. Â I suffered the same way and finally had to change from Safari to Chrome on my Mac Book to get in to do some listing and shipping.Â This weeks issue is getting an error when I try to print labels. Â The process works enough to Buy the label, but won't print it, hitting the button buys me another label and another. Â I have an in-box full of PayPal refunds for unused and unprinted postage.Â - When Hub rolled out, I couldn't get page to stay loaded for weeks. Â It kept loading and refreshing.Â - When they rolled out the Catalog idea, I lost hundreds and hundreds of my listings photos and had them replaced by a single stock image, that may (or may not) have been my item. Â A few listings ended up with NO photos at all.Â - When the last Item Specifics update rolled out, I lost data in dozens of listings and got a message saying they were expanding the Item Specifics yet again.Â Each time they update a page or make software mods and Seller Update, it seems to be a big hassle and time suck.

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: @hanks2016Â Â Here is what eBay currently recommends as far as browsers go:Â https://www.ebay.com/help/policies/resolving-technical-issues/technical-issues?id=4220Â I think the Safari recommendation for Windows users is a typo, though. The latest version of Safari I have found that runs in Windows is Safari 5.1.7 ("copyright 2007-2012").Â I think which browser you choose is less important than how current it is, in most cases. And there are many other factors that may play a role as well such as javascript, VPNs, whether your SSL/TLS client is up to date, whether your browser allows cookies (and if your cookies have been updated recently enough). In some cases ad blockers or cross-site tracker blocking may cause sign-in or checkout issues as well.

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: First, I want to thank your for your comment and info to sent to help out.Â eBay has, or should have, some of the best folks in the business and they have Sellers with a huge variety of systems and experience with Computers and Apps. Â The changes they do should be as seamless as possible and cause as few interface issues as possible, but they don't. Â They roll out some pretty bad "updates". Â So much so that I cringe every time I get the message that the next Seller Update is coming. Â I really cringe at the pending "Managed Payments" program is pending.Â Obviously your a more computer savoy guy, then I am. Â In my twenties, I worked with complex systems such as Hydraulic and High Pressure air control systems and even computers, but they ran on binary or hexadecimal code, loaded by disc packs and mag tape. Â So my specific knowledge is obsolete.Â And even though I have not kept up with changes in technology, some aspects of my training remain true even today. Â You troubleshoot complex system issues by isolating the changes or actions that resulted in the system failure.Â It's true that I've had the same 2 aging Mac Book Pros for about a decade and they have served me well for general use and for managing my 2 eBay stores. Â They came loaded with Safari and from time to time I do an update download to keep them as current as they can be.Â So, when I have a week where several parts of eBay start getting flakey (log in screen, printing shipping labels, not being able to put in a % in Promoted Listings, etc) I have to ask myself "what changed". Â  I'm sitting at the same location, with the same Internet, using the same laptop and software, so why am I having issues today, that I didn't last week.Â Regarding eBay, it usually isn't that hard to note that some page layout or Seller Update occurred on the same day the issue arises. Â  If all is fine on Monday, what changed on Tuesday? Â The answer is almost always that eBay rolled out something new that doesn't work with some of the systems or settings sellers had on Monday.Â Most of us know the big issues these past few years:- When the Hub rolled out it was so unstable for a few weeks the page wouldn't stay loaded without refreshing.- When Cataloging came out, hundreds of my listing photos were lost or overwritten by stock photos.- Seller Update Item Specific requirements dropped a huge amount of data off my listings.Â But separate from the Big Glitches, it seems that each week users are faced with a constant change to Listing Templates, App Updates, New Features, Layout and Log-in changes and frankly they all come with issues. Â Keeping up with all the changes is a huge time suck.Â It's like the new shipping page format, which they changed 3 or 4 times a few months ago. Â They had a perfectly good layout that had been around for years. Â Then made a radical layout change and tried to make it so only the selections chosen for us were visible, rather then all the choices available. Â I could know, for instance, that I wanted to pick a Med Flat Rate Box, but couldn't get it to appear in the choices offered, without having to manipulate data and hit update. Â Their update was costing me more time, then the old system.Â Anyway, this is getting long. Â Thanks again.

heading: SIGN IN ISSUES
body: @hanks2016Â Â You are welcome.Â Your comments about troubleshooting are well-taken; my background is more hardware than software, so I think we may tend to approach problems similarly: what parts can we swap out, and what does that tell us about what is wrong?Â Certainly whenever eBay changes something there is the potential to cause problems for some users, or many users. There is no doubt that eBay does make a lot of dumb, sloppy changes. But eBay is not operating in a vacuum, and eBay's changes are not the only changes going on. Some of eBay's changes are a driven by (or the result of) other things changing, such as browser standards, or security practices. And even when eBay changes nothing, an update to a browser or even a common add-on can cause all sorts of issues. Not long ago a problem that prevented many users from searching for ended listings turned out to be the result of a minor change in a common ad blocker subscription list.Â I think a lot of users just sort of assume that because they did not explicitly change anything that the software they use is the same as it was yesterday; often that is not the case. And other folks are still using Internet Explorer 11 and wondering why many of their favorite web sites no longer work the way they used to.

heading: International FEES coming in July for MP.  I'm unclear of some things.
body: I'm having trouble figuring out the actual impact of the new policy coming in July for MP in regards to International sales.Â  An important issue to be sure as it will drive my decision to continue with international shipping or just going to US shipping only.Â And will these fees affect international buyers that we ship to here in the US?Â  I have my guesses on the new policy from how it is written, but I'm not at all sure I am clearly getting it.Â  So some clarity is needed.Â  I look forward to what others have to say.Â International feeIf your registered address is in the US, we charge an International fee if either the buyer's registered address or the delivery address for the item is located outside of the US. This fee is calculated as 1.65% of the total amount of the sale and is automatically deducted from your sales.Â If your registered address is not in the US, please refer to the fee page for your country of residence for your International fee information.Â Seller currency conversion chargeIf your registered address is in the US, when a buyer purchases your item in a currency other than your payout currency, eBay will convert the funds to your payout currency using a "transaction exchange rate" we set for the currency exchange. The transaction exchange rate is adjusted regularly and includes a currency conversion charge of 3% applied on a base exchange rate. The base exchange rate is based on rates within the wholesale currency markets on the conversion day or the prior business day; or, if required by law or regulation, set at the relevant government reference rate(s). The currency conversion charge will be automatically deducted from your sales.Â Â If your registered address is not in the US, please refer to the fee page for your country of residence for your Seller currency conversion charge information.

heading: International FEES coming in July for MP.  I'm unclear of some things.
body: The way I read this is as follows.Â If I have an international buyer purchase from me, even if they have a US ship to address, I pay the 11.5% Simplified Fee plus 1.65% for a total of 13.15%Â If I have a international buyerÂ  purchase from me, even if they have a US ship to address and pay in a currency OTHER than US $$$, I pay the 11.50% plus the 1.65% plus the 3% conversion fee for a total fee of 16.15%Â So my questions will be as follows.Â If I have this correct, is MP going to allow me to BLOCK buyers paying with NON US currency like we currently can in PP?Â Are the fees on an international sale also calculated on custom fees or taxes they may pay up front too?Â Currently when we pay fees on S&H for international sale it is based off the lowest rate offered to US sellers and NOT what we need to charge the international buyer for shipping.Â  Further if it is a Free US shipping listing they purchase from there is no FVF on the shipping.Â  So with the new rules for MP, how is this applied?Â  Are we paying the fees on the actual shipping paid by the buyer or is it as it currently is in Ebay?Â  Very important to know because if this has changed too, it can significantly increase costs to sellers on international sales.Â brian_burke@ebay

body: @millcreekrescue909Â wrote:Freight forwarders use a US address.I agree.Â  The additional fee for an international sale isn't unusual.Â  We've always paid a higher rate in PP for international transactions.Â So if that is all that applies, I personally have no issue.Â But if sellers are going to have to pay the conversion fee if the buyer pays with a different currency, then I think that is an issue as this is a fee that currently through PP is paid by the buyer, NOT the seller.Â And if the seller is having to take on the conversion fee as an expense, then will be be able to block such payments as you can in PP?Â Â Â And what shipping rate is the FVF calculated on?Â These things potentially add additional costs not currently experienced that need answers so we can be informed and know what to expect.

heading: Buyer requests refund
body: I am not a newb but I don't sell hundreds of items on eBay.Â  Here is my scenario, any help is appreciated.I sold a watch.Â  The watch was described accurately and working just fine.Â  The watch was packed well but took a bit longer to get to the buyer because it was sent to another part of the country.Â Â Buyer reached out said "The watch arrived yesterday. I left positive feedback for you. It is in very good condition"Â A day later the buyer contacts me and says the watch is not working and he couldn't get the watch back together after taking it apart.Â  Says they took it to a jeweler who told him parts were missing and the caseback was bent and they put it on a watch press and couldn't get it back together.Â Â Â Buyer is requesting a refund and was pretty rude in his replies to me.Â  I told him I would work with him with some $ in a partial refund but he is demanding a full refund.Â I have issue with someone who didn't know what they were doing (the buyer) taking the watch apart and then taking it to a jeweler who said a part was missing and the watch was damaged.Â  In his own words the watch was in very good condition.Â  Â Â Tried to reach out to eBay customer service with no luck.Â  What are my rights here.Â  My guess is he had the watch 24-48 hours before telling me there was an issue.Â  Sorry this is long winded just wanted the facts out there.Â  Any help would be great.
